intro: Tripleurospermum lesbiacum, commonly known as the Lesbia's ray floret, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
